meanings.definition: A fence or boundary formed by closely growing bushes or shrubs.
meanings.sent1: The hedges around the garden provide privacy.
meanings.sent2: I trimmed the hedges in the front yard yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to hide behind the hedges during the game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The hedges stood like guardians, protecting the house from prying eyes.
meanings.sent5: The sweet scent of the blooming hedges filled the air with freshness.

meanings.definition: To limit or qualify a statement or promise.
meanings.sent1: She hedges her answer to avoid revealing too much.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often hedge their promises to avoid backlash.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to hedge his commitment to the project by saying he would try his best.
meanings.sent4: His vague responses seemed to hedge his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The speaker carefully hedged his words to avoid any misunderstandings.

meanings.definition: To avoid making a direct statement.
meanings.sent1: He tends to hedge when asked about his future plans.
meanings.sent2: The witness tried to hedge around the sensitive question.
meanings.sent3: The comedian cleverly hedged his way out of answering the controversial question.
meanings.sent4: She skillfully hedged her response to keep the conversation light.
meanings.sent5: The student nervously hedged when the teacher asked about the missing homework.
